required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PVP-I Nasal Sprays and SARS-CoV-2 Nasopharyngeal Titers (for COVID-19)
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of PVP-I Nasal Sprays vs Normal Saline Nasal Sprays on SARS-CoV-2 Nasopharyngeal Titers

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to determine the safety and efficacy of povidone-iodine (PVP-I) containing nasal sprays as compared to isotonic saline nasal sprays in COVID-19 positive patients. The primary outcome measure is SARS-CoV-2 viral titers in the nasal cavity and nasopharynx. In vitro studies have shown PVP-I to be highly virucidal against the viruses which cause SARS and MERS. Additionally, clinical studies have shown PVP-I saline sprays to be well tolerated in human subjects. PVP-I oral rinses and sprays have been trialed as methods to reduce the incidence and symptoms of viruses which cause the "common cold."

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Cycle Threshold (Ct) Values Through Day 3 as a Measure of Change in Viral Titers of SARS-CoV-2
primary_outcome.description: Nasopharyngeal swabs were obtained and quantitative reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) testing was performed to determine the viral load in the nasopharynx. Cycle threshold (Ct) denotes how many PCR cycles are required before the SARS-CoV-2 viral RNA reached a detectable level. Higher Ct values correspond to lower viral copy numbers. For reference, Ct values of 20 correspond to ~2.12 x 106 viral copies per milliliter, while a Ct value of 40 is undetectable and is considered the lower limit of detection of this RT-PCR test for SARS-CoV-2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Count of Participants Experiencing Adverse Events of Interest After Nasal Sprays
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were asked on day 3 whether they experienced the adverse event since baseline, then asked on day 5 whether they experienced the adverse event since day 3 (collected by questionnaire). Adverse events of interest include: Nasal burning/pain, headaches, ear pain, sneezing, and nose bleeds.

secondary_outcome.measure: Count of Participants Experiencing Fevers as a Measure of Frequency of Symptoms Related to SARS-CoV-2
secondary_outcome.description: Count of participants that experienced fevers at either mild, moderate, or severe intensity. Participants were asked on day 3 whether they experienced the symptom since baseline, then asked on day 5 whether they experienced the symptom since day 3. Participants rated the severity of their symptoms on a 4-point Likert scale with "1" representing 'not experiencing that symptom,' "2" representing mild symptoms, "3" representing 'moderate symptoms,' and "4" representing 'severe symptoms.'

secondary_outcome.measure: Count of Participants Experiencing Chills as a Measure of Frequency of Symptoms Related to SARS-CoV-2
secondary_outcome.description: Count of participants that experienced chills at either mild, moderate, or severe intensity. Participants were asked on day 3 whether they experienced the symptom since baseline, then asked on day 5 whether they experienced the symptom since day 3. Participants rated the severity of their symptoms on a 4-point Likert scale with "1" representing 'not experiencing that symptom,' "2" representing mild symptoms, "3" representing 'moderate symptoms,' and "4" representing 'severe symptoms.'

secondary_outcome.measure: Count of Participants Experiencing Fatigue as a Measure of Frequency of Symptoms Related to SARS-CoV-2
secondary_outcome.description: Count of participants that experienced fatigue at either mild, moderate, or severe intensity. Participants were asked on day 3 whether they experienced the symptom since baseline, then asked on day 5 whether they experienced the symptom since day 3. Participants rated the severity of their symptoms on a 4-point Likert scale with "1" representing 'not experiencing that symptom,' "2" representing mild symptoms, "3" representing 'moderate symptoms,' and "4" representing 'severe symptoms.'

secondary_outcome.measure: Count of Participants Experiencing Loss of Sense of Smell as a Measure of Frequency of Symptoms Related to SARS-CoV-2
secondary_outcome.description: Count of participants that experienced loss of sense of smell at either mild, moderate, or severe intensity. Participants were asked on day 3 whether they experienced the symptom since baseline, then asked on day 5 whether they experienced the symptom since day 3. Participants rated the severity of their symptoms on a 4-point Likert scale with "1" representing 'not experiencing that symptom,' "2" representing mild symptoms, "3" representing 'moderate symptoms,' and "4" representing 'severe symptoms.'

secondary_outcome.measure: Count of Participants Experiencing Loss of Sense of Taste as a Measure of Frequency of Symptoms Related to SARS-CoV-2
secondary_outcome.description: Count of participants that experienced loss of sense of taste at either mild, moderate, or severe intensity. Participants were asked on day 3 whether they experienced the symptom since baseline, then asked on day 5 whether they experienced the symptom since day 3. Participants rated the severity of their symptoms on a 4-point Likert scale with "1" representing 'not experiencing that symptom,' "2" representing mild symptoms, "3" representing 'moderate symptoms,' and "4" representing 'severe symptoms.'

secondary_outcome.measure: Count of Participants Experiencing Nasal Congestion as a Measure of Frequency of Symptoms Related to SARS-CoV-2
secondary_outcome.description: Count of participants that experienced nasal congestion at either mild, moderate, or severe intensity. Participants were asked on day 3 whether they experienced the symptom since baseline, then asked on day 5 whether they experienced the symptom since day 3. Participants rated the severity of their symptoms on a 4-point Likert scale with "1" representing 'not experiencing that symptom,' "2" representing mild symptoms, "3" representing 'moderate symptoms,' and "4" representing 'severe symptoms.'

secondary_outcome.measure: Count of Participants Experiencing Sore Throat as a Measure of Frequency of Symptoms Related to SARS-CoV-2
secondary_outcome.description: Count of participants that experienced sore throat at either mild, moderate, or severe intensity. Participants were asked on day 3 whether they experienced the symptom since baseline, then asked on day 5 whether they experienced the symptom since day 3. Participants rated the severity of their symptoms on a 4-point Likert scale with "1" representing 'not experiencing that symptom,' "2" representing mild symptoms, "3" representing 'moderate symptoms,' and "4" representing 'severe symptoms.'
Participants were asked to estimated doses completed at day 5 (0-25%, 26-50%, 51-75%, or 76-100%). The count of participants who estimated their compliance to be within each range is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Count of Participants Normosmia, Microsmia, or Anosmia as a Measure of Change in the University of Pennsylvania Smell Identification Test (UPSIT)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants scratch test cards and attempt to identify the smell from a multiple choice set of options. Their scores are then computed and categorized as normosmia (normal), mild, moderate, or severe microsmia (loss of smell), or anosmia (total loss of smell).

arm_group.description: Participants will administer PVP-I 2% nasal spray for 5 days. Nasopharyngeal swabs will be taken on Day 1 at baseline, Day 1 at four hours post-first dose, and Day 5. Participants will complete a daily symptom journal from Day 1 through Day 5.

Participants will administer PVP-I 0.5% nasal spray for 5 days. Nasopharyngeal swabs will be taken on Day 1 at baseline, Day 1 at four hours post-first dose, and Day 5. Participants will complete a daily symptom journal from Day 1 through Day 5

Participants will administer two sprays of isotonic saline nasal spray for 5 days. Nasopharyngeal swabs will be taken on Day 1 at baseline, Day 1 at four hours post-first dose, and Day 5. Participants will complete a daily symptom journal from Day 1 through Day 5.

intervention.description: Two sprays to each nare of PVP-I 2% via nasal spray bottle, four times a day
Two sprays to each nare of PVP-I 0.5% via nasal spray bottle, four times a day
Two sprays to each nare of isotonic saline (0.9% NaCl) via nasal spray bottle, four times a day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of COVID-19 by lab test within 5 days of study participation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergy to "iodine," shellfish, or food dye
- Receiving intranasal steroids
- Sinus surgery within 30 days of beginning the study
- Intubated at the time of enrollment
- Pregnancy
- Participation in other COVID-19 studies - to be determined on a case by case basis

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 265 patients were assessed for eligibility; 47 patients were randomized into the study,

group.title: Isotonic Saline 0.9%
group.description: Participants administer 2 sprays of isotonic saline (0.9% NaCl) to each nare via nasal spray bottle, four times a day for 5 days.

group.title: Povidone-Iodine 0.5%
group.description: Participants administer 2 sprays of povidone-iodine (PVP-I) 0.5% to each nare via nasal spray bottle, four times a day for 5 days.

group.title: Povidone-Iodine 2%
group.description: Participants administer 2 sprays of PVP-I 2% to each nare via nasal spray bottle, four times a day for 5 days.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Did not present to study site for allocated intervention

baseline.population: Participants who received the allocated intervention and completed the study; participants with negative PCR nasal swab results at baseline or incomplete data were excluded.

group.title: Isotonic Saline 0.9%
group.description: Participants administer 2 sprays of isotonic saline (0.9% NaCl) to each nare via nasal spray bottle, four times a day for 5 days.

group.title: Povidone-Iodine 0.5%
group.description: Participants administer 2 sprays of PVP-I 0.5% to each nare via nasal spray bottle, four times a day for 5 days.

group.title: Povidone-Iodine 2%
group.description: Participants administer 2 sprays of PVP-I 2% to each nare via nasal spray bottle, four times a day for 5 days.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

Sex: Female, Male

outcome.title: Mean Cycle Threshold (Ct) Values Through Day 3 as a Measure of Change in Viral Titers of SARS-CoV-2
outcome.description: Nasopharyngeal swabs were obtained and quantitative reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) testing was performed to determine the viral load in the nasopharynx. Cycle threshold (Ct) denotes how many PCR cycles are required before the SARS-CoV-2 viral RNA reached a detectable level. Higher Ct values correspond to lower viral copy numbers. For reference, Ct values of 20 correspond to ~2.12 x 106 viral copies per milliliter, while a Ct value of 40 is undetectable and is considered the lower limit of detection of this RT-PCR test for SARS-CoV-2.
outcome.population: Participants who received the allocated intervention and completed the study; participants with negative PCR nasal swab results at baseline or incomplete data were excluded.

group.description: Participants administer 2 sprays of isotonic saline (0.9% NaCl) to each nare via nasal spray bottle, four times a day for 5 days.

group.title: Povidone-Iodine 2%
group.description: Participants administer 2 sprays of PVP-I 2% to each nare via nasal spray bottle, four times a day for 5 days.

measure.title: Mean Cycle Threshold (Ct) Values Through Day 3 as a Measure of Change in Viral Titers of SARS-CoV-2
measure.description: Nasopharyngeal swabs were obtained and quantitative reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) testing was performed to determine the viral load in the nasopharynx. Cycle threshold (Ct) denotes how many PCR cycles are required before the SARS-CoV-2 viral RNA reached a detectable level. Higher Ct values correspond to lower viral copy numbers. For reference, Ct values of 20 correspond to ~2.12 x 106 viral copies per milliliter, while a Ct value of 40 is undetectable and is considered the lower limit of detection of this RT-PCR test for SARS-CoV-2.
measure.population: Participants who received the allocated intervention and completed the study; participants with negative PCR nasal swab results at baseline or incomplete data were excluded.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis of change in mean Ct values incorporating baseline, hour 1, and day 3 values.
Analysis of change in mean Ct values incorporating baseline, hour 1, and day 3 values.

outcome.title: Count of Participants Normosmia, Microsmia, or Anosmia as a Measure of Change in the University of Pennsylvania Smell Identification Test (UPSIT)
outcome.description: Participants scratch test cards and attempt to identify the smell from a multiple choice set of options. Their scores are then computed and categorized as normosmia (normal), mild, moderate, or severe microsmia (loss of smell), or anosmia (total loss of smell).
outcome.population: Participants who received the allocated intervention and completed the study and with data available for the respective time point; participants with negative PCR nasal swab results at baseline or incomplete data were excluded.

measure.description: Participants scratch test cards and attempt to identify the smell from a multiple choice set of options. Their scores are then computed and categorized as normosmia (normal), mild, moderate, or severe microsmia (loss of smell), or anosmia (total loss of smell).
measure.population: Participants who received the allocated intervention and completed the study and with data available for the respective time point; participants with negative PCR nasal swab results at baseline or incomplete data were excluded.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The study did not meet its accrual goal of 45 participants with analyzable data.
